arm_group.description: Mat Pilates training performed two times at week for 16 weeks.

brief_summary.textblock:
The study aimed to evaluate the chronic effects of Mat Pilates Training on blood pressure,
      heart rate, double product  and psychobiological factors in hypertensive medicated women and
      acute effects of Mat Pilates Exercise on blood pressure of such individuals.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Mat Pilates Training on Blood Pressure of Hypertensive Individuals

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Hypertensives women

          -  Age 30 to 59 years

          -  Nonactive

          -  Make use of antihypertensive medication

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Orthopedic problems or other problem that prevented the exercises

          -  Change in drug treatment during protocol

          -  Absence in more than 25% of the exercise sessions

intervention.description: Mat Pilates training performed two times at week for 16 weeks.

clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Mat Pilates Training on Blood Pressure of Hypertensive Individuals

primary_outcome.description: Blood pressure was measured by Ambulatorial Monitoring Blood Pressure before and after trial period and by semiautomatic monitoring before and after a single session of Mat Pilates exercise.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Heart Rate was measured by Ambulatorial Monitoring Blood Pressure before and after trial period and by semiautomatic monitoring before and after a single session of Mat Pilates exercise.
Anxiety was analyzed by State-Trait Anxiety Inventory (STAI), before and after trial period.
Stress was analysed by perceived stress questionnaire, before and after trial period.
Depression was analysed by Beck's Depression Inventory (BDI), before and after trial period.
Sleep quality was analysed by The Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index (PSQI), before and after trial period.
Perception of Sleep was analysed by Mini Sleep Questionnaire, before and after trial period.
Sleepiness was analysed by Epworth Sleepiness Scale, before and after trial period.
Quality of Life was analysed by Questionnaire for Health-Related Quality of Life assessment of hypertensive patients, before and after trial period.
Flexibility was analysed by Bank of wells, before and after trial period.
Strength was analysed by hydraulic handgrip dynamometer, before and after trial period.

collaborator.agency: Fundação de Amparo à Pesquisa do Estado de São Paulo

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Non-Randomized, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
